The Institute of Contemporary Arts (ICA) in London has appointed Michael Crowley as its interim curator of contemporary art. Crowley is currently working on a book about the intersection of photography and modernism and will present the exhibition “Photography & the Modernist,” at the Institute in the spring of 2021. The exhibition will feature work by more than seventy artists.“We are extremely grateful to Michael for his work in elevating contemporary photography and the art of the twentieth century,” said Simon Bailey, who has worked with Crowley at the ICA and is now director of the Institute. “Over the last five years he has been an incredibly talented curator, a true champion of art and a true friend of the ICA. He has been instrumental in my inclusion in the ICA’s program and has been a pleasure to work with.”

The Manhattan Museum of Art (MoMA) and the Philadelphia Museum of Art (PMA) announced today that they have reached an agreement that will establish a new public-private partnership for the construction of new works by artists in the United States. The partnership, which will launch in 2020 with the opening of the exhibition “Elizabeth Bishop: Modern Heart,” will involve the acquisition of more than 1,100 works by twenty-six artists, including Ilya Sutske and Alireza Sabur, and will extend to the creation of the Elizabeth Bishop Museum.The partnership will also include the development of a new digital platform that will allow patrons to find works by the artists they have chosen and will allow MoMA to provide visitors with a catalog of the works it has acquired.
